results.title: A Drop in the bucket
results.creator_credit: Joseph Henabery, United States. Public Health Service and Warner-Pathe News
results.brief_description: Dramatised story of how dentists, civic leaders, health officials, and people of a town agreed to add fluoride to the community water supply. Explains how the fluoride is added, the cost of fluoridation, and the benefits accruing to the community.

results.title: A Dream to create a home
results.creator_credit: Wendy Walters, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Wendy Walters and her group of passionate people set about building a home for ninety people in Mill Park, Victoria. Through the dreams and idealism is frustration at the struggle to make this building home for so many different people.

results.title: A Dream of Norway
results.creator_credit: Ronald Craigen, Edgar H. Anstey, British Transport Films and Bergen Line
results.brief_description: From the moment that the “Leda” sets sail for Bergen, the holidaymaker’s imagination reaches forward to the fjord and mountain roads, glaciers and waterfalls, with Edward Grieg’s “Variations on an old Norwegian romance” to reflect the changing moods of Western Norway.

results.title: A double tour = Web of passion
results.creator_credit: Claude Chabrol, Raymond Hakim and Robert Hakim
results.brief_description:
Henri is married to Therese and together they have two children. Henri also has a mistress, Leda. The adulterous relationship is known to all around him, but all feign to ignore it. One day, Therese breaks the silence and confronts Henri about Leda. Not long after, Leda is found dead. ‘A double tour’, Chabrol’s first colour film, is especially notable for its striking cinematography, its complex narrative structure, and the exuberance of its flamboyant style; it represents Chabrol’s first studied attempt to examine and criticize the moral values of the bourgeoisie as well as to dissect the sociopsychological causes of the violence which inevitably erupts as the social and family structures prove inadequate.” Reference: Charles Derry. ‘Claude Chabrol’. Online. Available: http://www.geocities.com/Paris/Metro/9384/directors/chabrol/derry.htm ; Originally published: ‘International Dictionary of Films and Filmmakers, Vol. 2: Directors, 3rd ed. (Detroit: St. James Press, 1997), p. 148, 150-151.

Credits: Producer, Robert and Raymond Hakim ; director, Claude Chabrol ; writers, Paul Gegauff, Claude Chabrol ; photography, Henri Decae ; music, Paul Misraki ; art direction, Jacques Saulnier, Bernard Evein ; director’s assistant, Philippe De Broca
Cast: Jacques Dacqmine, Antonella Lualdi, Andre Jocelyn, Jeanne Valerie, Bernadette Lafont, Madeleine Robinson, Jean-Paul Belmondo.

results.title: A Dose of reality
results.creator_credit: Suzanne St Pierre and CBS News
results.brief_description: A study of death and dying with emphasis on giving the terminally ill patient a choice in making decisions until the end. A nurse at a Pennsylvania hospital has developed a unique program for the dying patient. Looks at the prospect of death and what can be done to make it easier for the patient and family.

results.title: A Dose of reality
results.creator_credit: Andrew Dobbyn, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Andrew Dobbyn feels he has lived a privileged life. A baby boomer with a war veteran father, Dobbyn’s family did what they could to help the wives and children of those who didn’t return from the war. Despite this, Dobbyn felt he could be doing more and highlights two events in his life that showed him just how lucky he is.

results.title: A Dolphin's story
results.creator_credit: Arthur Everard, David H. Fowler and New Zealand National Film Unit
results.brief_description: A bottlenose dolphin is captured in the Marlborough Sounds. The good natured animal is transported to “Marineland of New Zealand” in Napier and trained there. The film records its story through to the first public performance.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Arthur Everard, David H. Fowler and New Zealand National Film Unit
